page.title: 04CAULDWELL FARM, BITTESWELL
page.content: My granny and grandpa bought our farm in August 1955. It cost Â£9,250 with 149 acres, 16 buildings (including the house) and sheep dip. They brought with them their milking herd, and then bought some sheep. When they bought the farm they had a garden with a vegetable patch, a path through the middle and an outside toilet. We had five buildings and one of them was the biggest in the district at the time. We have two yards,one cobbled and the other concreted. In one field we have got a spring. We have two wells, one in the house and one in the cobbled yard. There is a bog in one of our fields. Our fields are nearly all grass, but we have a lot of barley, wheat and potatoes.
